1.4.7: Emergency Bug Fix for a PHP Error. I rebuilt a big chunk of the plugin recently, and it turns out that I still had a call to one of the functions from the old version. It was a call to a PHP function that now no longer exists and has been replaced with a new function. I thought I had all of these replaced, but I had missed one. My apologies to all for the hassle of needing two updates in one day, and I thank you all for your patience and support.

1.3.14: Upgrading some of the functions regarding Bitly and the Vertical Floating buttons.

  • The Bitly integration is now smarter than ever. It only generates shortlinks during the background cache rebuild process so that whether it fails or not, there is no reduction in load time performance.
  • The floating buttons can now be turned on or off independent of the horizontal buttons. They can appear alongside the horizontal buttons or all by themselves. You can control this on the 'Display Locations' tab or on any post editor itself.

1.3.13: Fixed a hiccup in the Bitly API that was causing it to not connect leading to prolonged page load times. Also, modified the trigger for resetting the cache to improve the way it functions with updating Open Graph images and whatnot.

1.3.10: Fixed an error code that was displaying in the last version and adjusted the alignment of side floating buttons when very little space is available in the margin of the page.

1.3.9: This version brings some huge performance optimizations. The goal is to make this plugin have as close as possible to absolutely no impact on the load time of posts and pages.

  • 1. New Feature: Added a shortcode generator for quickly and easily embedding share buttons directly into posts including share buttons that reflect a differnt page or post than what is being viewed.
  • 2. New Feature: Upgraded the Click-to-Tweet shortcode generator. It now allows you to specify whether you want to use your default style or select a specific one for each instance.
  • 3. Performance: Made it so that Google and other search engines are always served cached numbers so they always get the fastest version of the page.
  • 4. Performance: Reduced database queries down to zero when serving cached data.
  • 5. Performance: Eliminated the Click-to-Tweet CSS file and the image that was used for the icon cutting out 2 of the http requests.
  • 6. Performance: Made it so the cache is rebuilt silently after the page has already completed loading. This means that all API requests and database calls are now conducted in a way that will never slow down the time it takes to generate and load the page for the user.
  • 7. Performance: Several other modifications were made including how the html is generated for the buttons, how functions are called, and more that all help to reduce the performance footprint of this plugin as much as possible.

  • Refined the mobile sizing algorithm. The buttons will now show counts on mobile if it measures and determines that there is enough space to do so.
  • Modified the way buttons are sized so that if a site hides the content and then fades it into view using javascript, our plugin will now wait until it is visible prior to sizing them.
  • Added Frensh button translations.
  • Fixed an error that was causing the background of the floating share bar to always be white regardless of what color it was set to be.
  • Fixed the registration page infinite loop error.
  • Reduced the size of the javascript from 34KB to 11KB for front-end page loads.

    1.2.3: This is another update packed with new features. Check this out:

    • Updated the way Twitter cards work. Now if you don't have any images added, it will revert to the standard, non-image Twitter summary card.
    • Added a share recover system. If you've ever changed your permalink structure on your blog, you can now recover the shares that had been made on your previous URL structure.
    • Added a shortcode function that allows you to place Social Warfare buttons on any page, but reflect all settings (share counts, links, titles, descriptions, and images) of a different page. For example, you might want to place buttons on a 'Thank You For Subscribing' page, but you want to reflect the share counts of the actual 'Subscribe' call-to-action page. And more importantly, that the page you want your users sharing after they subscribe. This one can be powerful. Here's an example shortcode to show how it works: [social_warfare post_id="127"]. The post_id field can be the ID of a post, page or any other custom post type that has a WordPress ID.
    • Fixed an issue with how the excerpt was being formatted for the open graph and Twitter card descriptions that was, in some cases, adding a 'Read More' html tag to the header of a page.
    • I've also expanded the amount of information that's output to the Open Graph tags. I've also ensured that our plugin coordinates intelligently with WordPress SEO by Yoast (when installed) when generating these open graph tags.
    • Fixed a typo in the CSS that was making the wrong font appear on the side floating buttons.
    • Added Dutch to the list of available languages courtesy of Daniel Philipsen. That means we now have 5 languages built in. Please contact us if you'd like to contribue a new language for us.

    1.2.2: This update is all about Twitter.

    • Added Twitter Cards. Woot! Woot!
    • I've also added a 'Twitter Username' field to user's profiles. Now, if you want, you can add individual author usernames and have the 'via @username' point to the author of that post.
    • I also modified the behavior of the Open Graph tags. This should now work much, much better.

    1.2.1: Minor bug fix from the 1.2.0 upgrade.

    1.2.0: This update has been a big push to create developer hooks that will hopefully get more developers involved and help to expand the available features through the creation of addons or functions.php recipes. In order to do this, we've been toiling behind the scenes rebuilding many files and functions from the ground up. Here's a look what this update brings with it:

    • 1. Changed the way the user's options selections are fetched drastically reducing database calls.
    • 2. Changed the way the buttons are sized
    • 3. Built in a multilingual functionality. There is currently only one language (Enlish), but now others can easily be added to the plugin. Feel free to send us translations that you would like to see added to the plugin.
    • 4. Changed the way share counts are fetched. Previously each share count was fetched one at a time beginning the request as soon as the previous request was finished. Now all share requests fire off at the same time. This will drastically reduce the amount of time it takes to fetch new share counts when the cache on the existing counts expires.
    • 5. Added a developer hook to allow additional link shortening integrations to be created.
    • 6. Added a developer hook to allow additional analytics parameters to be used with Social Warfare.
    • 7. Changed the priority of the Social Warfare function hook to fix the double share button bug.
    • 8. Added developer hooks for adding options to the Social Warfare settings page and also to fetch the options that the user has set.
    • 9. The developer hooks necessary to add additional social network share buttons are about 75% complete.
    • 10. Adjusted some CSS to clean up the custom options display on the post editor.
    • 11. Fixed some trailing commas in the javascript file that may have interfered with minifying the javascript.
    • 12. Fixed an issue with the naming of our widget function to avoid conflicts with other plugins that were using the same naming pattern.
    • For more information about this update and our vision for the future, check out our blog post here: Social Warfare 1.2: Developer Hooks, Major Optimizations, and Bug Fixes.
